description_txt: stated on May 8, 2012 in a campaign mailer:
quote_txt: Says "Schaufler was the only Democrat who voted to stop" the state’s health care reform plan.

description_txt: stated on April 5, 2012 in a statement:
quote_txt: If Congress froze the current spending level and then cut it by 2 percent annually, "we could balance the budget in five years."

description_txt: stated on May 8, 2012 in a speech in Albany, N.Y.:
quote_txt: "The only time government employment has gone down during a recession has been under me."

description_txt: stated on April 28, 2012 in a song/speech:
quote_txt: Says Gov. Scott Walker approved a "gutting" of two tax credits that help the poor and elderly.

description_txt: stated on April 1, 2012 in an interview with on NJTV's "On The Record.":
quote_txt: New Jersey has "the highest property taxes in the nation and not by a little. They are the highest property taxes in the nation, more than double the national average."

description_txt: stated on May 7, 2012 in an interview with Indiana Public Media:
quote_txt: Says he did not vote for Nancy Pelosi for speaker of the House.

description_txt: stated on May 8, 2012 in a campaign mailer.:
quote_txt: Says challenger Dominic Chavez is a "Rick Perry Republican" lobbyist.

description_txt: stated on April 30, 2012 in a Web ad:
quote_txt: U.S. Sen. Bill Nelson "chose to side with President Obama" against the Keystone pipeline

description_txt: stated on April 16, 2012 in an Austin mayoral debate on KXAN-TV:
quote_txt: Says Austin Mayor Lee Leffingwell voted for a toll lane on MoPac.

description_txt: stated on March 30, 2012 in a campaign video on the city's website:
quote_txt: Says no Austin City Council "member lives south of" Lady Bird Lake "or north of 45th Street."

description_txt: stated on May 4, 2012 in a speech at a Cato Institute event:
quote_txt: "We are coming up on our 40th anniversary of electing a Republican to the United States Senate. 1972 was the last time New Jersey sent a Republican to the United States Senate."

description_txt: stated on May 7, 2012 in an interview on NJToday:
quote_txt: "There has not been a Democratic woman in Congress from New Jersey in almost four decades."

description_txt: stated on April 19, 2012 in a presentation:
quote_txt: Crime rises in communities with casinos.

description_txt: stated on May 2, 2012 in an email statement:
quote_txt: Says that Rep. Betty Sutton "would rather riot with Occupy (Wall Street) than stand up for Ohio families."

description_txt: stated on May 8, 2012 in a press release:
quote_txt: The Obama White House recognizes a "baby that has not been born" for security purposes.

description_txt: stated on May 3, 2012 in a graphical tool on the campaign website:
quote_txt: Says Mitt Romney "has refused to say whether he would have vetoed or signed the Lilly Ledbetter Fair Pay Act."

description_txt: stated on May 5, 2012 in a campaign speech in Ohio:
quote_txt: Mitt Romney has "proposed cutting his own taxes while raising them on 18 million working families."

description_txt: stated on May 8, 2012 in a Twitter messaging campaign:
quote_txt: Says that U.S. Sen. Marco Rubio says troops are leaving Iraq "too fast."

description_txt: stated on May 4, 2012 in campaign material :
quote_txt: Says he "is the only candidate in the race for Clackamas County Chair who will refuse to join the Public Employees Retirement System."

description_txt: stated on May 5, 2012 in a speech in Columbus, Ohio:
quote_txt: Says Mitt Romney is proposing a "tax cut that gives an average of $250,000 to every millionaire in this country."

description_txt: stated on April 23, 2012 in a speech:
quote_txt: Each U.S. House member who voted to overhaul Social Security in 1983 was re-elected.

description_txt: stated on April 25, 2012 in a speech in the Ohio House:
quote_txt: Says Ohio law gives tax breaks "to rich people who own private jets."

description_txt: stated on May 4, 2012 in an interview on "Fox & Friends":
quote_txt: "We should be seeing numbers in the 500,000 jobs created per month. (Creating 115,000 jobs, the total from April 2012) is way, way, way off from what should happen in a normal recovery."

description_txt: stated on May 1, 2012 in a campaign website:
quote_txt: The congressional district for Miami-Dade and Broward counties has a "staggering drop-out rate of almost 61 percent."

description_txt: stated on April 15, 2012 in as quoted in Austin American-Statesman news article.:
quote_txt: Says Williamson County District Attorney John Bradley reduces 36 percent of felonies to misdemeanors and hands them off to her.

description_txt: stated on May 1, 2012 in a news release:
quote_txt: Says "an unchecked Democratic Majority in Trenton" is responsible for "years of diversions" from the state’s unemployment insurance trust fund.

description_txt: stated on April 21, 2012 in a TV interview.:
quote_txt: The U.S. economy is "recovering slower than Europe "

description_txt: stated on April 15, 2012 in a news release:
quote_txt: Says the average Ohio student graduates from a four-year college or university with nearly $27,000 in tuition debt.

description_txt: stated on April 18, 2012 in a speech:
quote_txt: "The United States imprisons more than any nation in the world."

description_txt: stated on April 26, 2012 in a tweet:
quote_txt: Says Gov. Scott Walker "has caused Wisconsin to lose more jobs than any other state in the country."
